briefdescription.para: This is the current position in data buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Making it mutable means the value can be altered even if an object of this class is const.

briefdescription.para: Limit is the position just past the last valid data byte.
Mark is set to mark a position in the buffer.
Offset is the offset into the buffer (used when calling slice()) at which position is defined to be 0.
Capacity is the total size of this buffer's available data in bytes.
Total size is the original capacity of this buffer's available data in bytes when the initial ByteBuffer was created and without slice() having been called.

detaileddescription.para: If slice has been called, a new, and possibly smaller capacity has been set. We need to remember the original size in order to properly copy this object when necessary.

briefdescription.para: This buffer is implemented with an array.

detaileddescription.para: Has shared pointer access in order to implement the duplicate() method. Note that a shared pointer to vector is not used since in one constructor, the underlying array is passed in as an arg.

briefdescription.para: Byte order of data.

detaileddescription.para: In java, default is big endian.

briefdescription.para: Is the data the same endian as the host? Convenience variable.
Is the data little endian? Convenience variable.
Is the pointer pased to the constructor pointed to file mapped memory? I.e.

detaileddescription.para: does it need to be unmapped by destructor?

briefdescription.para: Default constructor, size of 4096 bytes.
Constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Reserves specified size in internal array.
size
size (in bytes) of space to preallocate internally.

detaileddescription.para:
Not available in Java, but useful in C++.
srcBuf
ByteBuffer to copy.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer to move.

briefdescription.para: This constructor is equivalent to the ByteBuffer.wrap() method in Java.

detaileddescription.para: The byteArray arg needs to be created as a result to calling "new" as it's made part of a shared pointer! There is also some risk here if caller continues to use byteArray pointer independently of this object. Don't do it!

parameterdescription.para: pointer to array which this object will wrap.
length of array in bytes.
is the byteArray arg a pointer obtained through mmap (file memory mapping)?.

length of array in bytes.

Way of checking if the 2 buffers are pointing to the same data.
rhs

parameterdescription.para: right side object.

briefdescription.para: Subscript operator for absolute access to data bytes without limit check.

detaileddescription.para:
This has no Java counterpart.
index
index into internal data vector.
reference to internal byte in data vector at the given index.

briefdescription.para: Subscript operator for absolute access to data bytes of const ByteBuffers without limit check.

detaileddescription.para:
This has no Java counterpart.
index
index into internal data vector.
reference to internal byte in data vector at the given index.

briefdescription.para: This method compacts this buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The bytes between the buffer's position and its limit, if any, are copied to the beginning of the buffer. That is, the byte at index p = position() is copied to index zero, the byte at index p + 1 is copied to index one, and so forth until the byte at index limit() - 1 is copied to index n = limit() - 1 - p. The buffer's position is then set to n+1 and its limit is set to its capacity. The mark, if defined, is discarded. The buffer's position is set to the number of bytes copied, rather than to zero, so that an invocation of this method can be followed immediately by an invocation of another relative put method.

briefdescription.para: This method writes zeroes into the buffer memory (from pos = 0 to capacity).

detaileddescription.para: If this ByteBuffer was obtained through calling slice, the underlying data array may not be fully zeroed as position = 0 may occur at a non-zero offset and the capacity may be less than the array's total size. Although this method does not exist in the original Java ByteBuffer class, in Java, all objects have their memory zeroed so this may be useful.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::shared_ptr< const ByteBuffer > &srcBuf, size_t pos, size_t limit)
memberdef.name: copyData

briefdescription.para: Copy the source buffer's data (position to limit) into this buffer starting at local position 0.

detaileddescription.para:
Limit and capacity are set to the "limit - position" bytes of srcBuf. This can reallocate memory if more is needed and can therefore resize this buffer. Existing data in this buffer will be overwritten.
srcBuf
ByteBuffer to copy data from.
position
position in srcByf to start from.
limit
position in srcByf to end at.

briefdescription.para: Copy data and everything else from arg.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer to copy.

briefdescription.para: Copy data and everything else from arg.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer to copy.

briefdescription.para: This method tests for data equivilancy.

detaileddescription.para: Two byte buffers are equal if, and only if, they have the same number of remaining elements, and the two sequences of remaining elements, considered independently of their starting positions, are pointwise equal.

parameterdescription.para: A reference to a ByteBuffer to compare to this one

simplesect.para: True if the internal buffers match, otherwise False.

briefdescription.para: This method expands the size of this buffer if it's less than the given size.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that all ByteBuffers that currently share memory with this object, either through being assigned, by calling duplicate, or by calling slice, will no longer share memory. New memory is allocated. Useful in C++, but has no counterpart in Java. Bytes up to limit are copied. New memory past limit is not zeroed. All other internals are kept the same, including all data within the limit.
size
new size (in bytes) of space to allocate internally.

briefdescription.para: This method has no relevance to this C++ library.

detaileddescription.para:
This always returns false since it is backed by an array.
false.

briefdescription.para: Tells whether or not this buffer is backed by an array.

detaileddescription.para:
This always returns true since it is backed by an array.
true.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether there are bytes remaining between the position and limit, i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
position() < limit().
position < limit.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether this buffer is read only.

detaileddescription.para:
Always returns false;
false.

briefdescription.para: Get the byte order of the data.
Get a pointer to this buffer's backing array which contains the data.

detaileddescription.para:
Note, there may be a non-zero offset which can be found by calling arrayOffset. Do not free or delete this array!
pointer to the data array.

briefdescription.para: Get a shared pointer to this buffer's backing array which contains the data.

detaileddescription.para:
Note, there may be a non-zero offset which can be found by calling arrayOffset.
shared pointer to the data array.

briefdescription.para: Get the offset within this buffer's backing array of the first element of the buffer.

simplesect.para: offset within this buffer's backing array of the first element of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of bytes from the current position to the end of the data.

briefdescription.para: Returns the position of the buffer.
Sets the buffer's mark at its position.
Clears this buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
The position is set to 0, the limit is set to the capacity, and the mark is discarded. Data remains untouched.
this buffer.

briefdescription.para: Flips this buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
The limit is set to the current position and then the position is set to 0. The mark is discarded. Gets buffer ready for reading.
this buffer.

briefdescription.para: Resets this buffer's position to the previously-marked position.

parameterdescription.para: if mark < 0.

The position is set to 0 and the mark is discarded.

detaileddescription.para:
It does NOT do any byte swapping.

briefdescription.para: Returns a byte buffer that shares this buffer's content.

detaileddescription.para: The content of the returned buffer will be that of this buffer. Changes to this buffer's content will be visible in the returned buffer, and vice versa; the two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent.
The returned buffer's capacity, limit, position, and mark values will initially be identical to those of this buffer.

The C++ version of this method departs from the Java which has no argument. To implement this method, one could return a unique pointer to a locally created ByteBuffer object which would eliminate the need for an argument. However, handling the new buffer would be different from handling those created by the constructor since the caller would have a unique pointer instead of a ByteBuffer reference.

A cleaner way to do this is for the caller to create their own, new ByteBuffer object and pass it in as an argument. This method then makes it identical to this buffer and the data (implemented as a shared pointer) is shared between the objects. The buffer passed in as an argument is also the one returned.

parameterdescription.para: byte buffer to be made a duplicate of this one.

simplesect.para: the same byte buffer as passed in as the argument.

briefdescription.para: Returns a byte buffer that shares this buffer's content.

detaileddescription.para: The content of the returned buffer will be that of this buffer. Changes to this buffer's content will be visible in the returned buffer, and vice versa; the two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent.
The returned buffer's capacity, limit, position, and mark values will initially be identical to those of this buffer.

The C++ version of this method departs from the Java which has no argument. To implement this method, one could return a unique pointer to a locally created ByteBuffer object which would eliminate the need for an argument. However, handling the new buffer would be different from handling those created by the constructor since the caller would have a unique pointer instead of a ByteBuffer reference.

A cleaner way to do this is for the caller to create their own, new ByteBuffer object and pass it in as an argument. This method then makes it identical to this buffer and the data (implemented as a shared pointer) is shared between the objects. The buffer passed in as an argument is also the one returned.

The C++ version of this method departs from the Java which has no argument. To implement this method, one could return a unique pointer to a locally created ByteBuffer object which would eliminate the need for an argument. However, handling the new buffer would be different from handling those created by the constructor since the caller would have a unique pointer instead of a ByteBuffer reference.

A cleaner way to do this is for the caller to create their own, new ByteBuffer object and pass it in as an argument. This method then makes it identical to this buffer and the data (implemented as a shared pointer) is shared between the objects. The buffer passed in as an argument is also the one returned.

parameterdescription.para: byte buffer to be made a duplicate of this one.

simplesect.para: the same byte buffer as passed in as the argument.

briefdescription.para: The given (and returned) byte buffer is one whose content is a shared subsequence of this buffer's content.

detaileddescription.para: The content of the given buffer will start at this buffer's current position. Changes to this buffer's content will be visible in the given buffer, and vice versa; the two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent.
The given buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and its limit will be the number of bytes remaining in this buffer, and its mark will be undefined.

parameterdescription.para: byte buffer to be made a slice of this one.

simplesect.para: the same byte buffer as passed in as the argument.

briefdescription.para: The given (and returned) byte buffer is one whose content is a shared subsequence of this buffer's content.

detaileddescription.para: The content of the given buffer will start at this buffer's current position. Changes to this buffer's content will be visible in the given buffer, and vice versa; the two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent.
The given buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and its limit will be the number of bytes remaining in this buffer, and its mark will be undefined.

parameterdescription.para: byte buffer to be made a slice of this one.

simplesect.para: the same byte buffer as passed in as the argument.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new byte buffer whose content is a shared subsequence of this buffer's content.

detaileddescription.para: The content of the new buffer will start at this buffer's current position. Changes to this buffer's content will be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa; the two buffers' position, limit, and mark values will be independent.
The new buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and its limit will be the number of bytes remaining in this buffer, and its mark will be undefined.

briefdescription.para: Relative bulk get method.

detaileddescription.para: This method transfers bytes from this buffer into the given destination array. If there are fewer bytes remaining in the buffer than are required to satisfy the request, then no bytes are transferred and an underflow_error is thrown.

Otherwise, this method copies length bytes from this buffer into the given array, starting at the current position of this buffer and at the given pointer. The position of this buffer is then incremented by length.

parameterdescription.para: array into which bytes are to be written.
number of bytes to be written to the given array; must be no larger than dst size - offset.
if fewer than length bytes remaining in buffer.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< uint8_t > &dst, size_t offset, size_t length) const
memberdef.name: getBytes

briefdescription.para: Relative bulk get method.

detaileddescription.para: This method transfers bytes from this buffer into the given destination vector. If there are fewer bytes remaining in the buffer than are required to satisfy the request, then no bytes are transferred and an underflow_error is thrown.

Otherwise, this method copies length bytes from this buffer into the given array, starting at the current position of this buffer and at the given offset in the array. The position of this buffer is then incremented by length.

parameterdescription.para: vector into which bytes are to be written.
offset (bytes) within the vector of the first byte to be written.
number of bytes to be written to the given vector.
if fewer than length bytes remaining in buffer.

briefdescription.para: Relative get method.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the byte at this buffer's current position, but does not increments the position.

parameterdescription.para: if buffer's current position is not smaller than its limit.

briefdescription.para: Relative get method.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the byte at this buffer's current position, and then increments the position.

parameterdescription.para: if buffer's current position is not smaller than its limit.

briefdescription.para: Absolute get method.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the byte at the given index.

parameterdescription.para: index from which the byte will be read
if index is not smaller than buffer's limit.

briefdescription.para: Relative get method for reading a 16-bit unicode character value which is by nature unsigned.

detaileddescription.para: Keeping the name as "getChar" makes it compatible with Java, but be aware it does NOT get a 8-bit "char" type. This method reads the next two bytes at this buffer's current position, composing them into a wchar_t value according to the current byte order, and then increments the position by two.

simplesect.para: wchar_t value at buffer's current position

parameterdescription.para: if fewer than two bytes remaining in buffer.

briefdescription.para: Absolute get method for reading a 16-bit unicode character value which is by nature unsigned.

detaileddescription.para: Reads at the given index. Keeping the name as "getChar" makes it compatible with Java, but be aware it does NOT get a 8-bit "char" type. This method reads the next two bytes at the given index, composing them into a wchar_t value according to the current byte order, and then increments the position by two.

parameterdescription.para: index from which the bytes will be read.

simplesect.para: wchar_t value at the given index.

parameterdescription.para: if fewer than two bytes remaining in buffer.

briefdescription.para: Relative get method for reading a short value.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the next two bytes at this buffer's current position, composing them into a short value according to the current byte order, and then increments the position by two.

simplesect.para: short value at buffer's current position.

parameterdescription.para: if fewer than two bytes remaining in buffer.

briefdescription.para: Absolute get method for reading a short value.

detaileddescription.para: Reads two bytes at the given index, composing them into a short value according to the current byte order.

parameterdescription.para: index from which the bytes will be read.

simplesect.para: short value at the given index.

parameterdescription.para: if index is not smaller than buffer's limit, minus one.

parameterdescription.para: if index is not smaller than buffer's limit, minus one.

briefdescription.para: Relative bulk put method.

detaileddescription.para: This method transfers the bytes remaining in the given source buffer into this buffer. If there are more bytes remaining in the source buffer than in this buffer, that is, if src.remaining()>remaining(), then no bytes are transferred and a EvioException is thrown.
Otherwise, this method copies n=src.remaining() bytes from the given buffer into this buffer, starting at each buffer's current position. The positions of both buffers are then incremented by n.

parameterdescription.para: source buffer from which bytes are to be read; must not be this buffer.
if source buffer is this buffer.
if insufficient space in this buffer for the remaining bytes in the source buffer.

briefdescription.para: Relative bulk put method.

detaileddescription.para: This method transfers the bytes remaining in the given source buffer into this buffer. If there are more bytes remaining in the source buffer than in this buffer, that is, if src.remaining()>remaining(), then no bytes are transferred and a EvioException is thrown.
Otherwise, this method copies n=src.remaining() bytes from the given buffer into this buffer, starting at each buffer's current position. The positions of both buffers are then incremented by n.

parameterdescription.para: source buffer from which bytes are to be read; must not be this buffer.
if source buffer is this buffer.
if insufficient space in this buffer for the remaining bytes in the source buffer.

briefdescription.para: Relative bulk put method.

detaileddescription.para: This method transfers bytes into this buffer from the given source array. If there are more bytes to be copied from the array than remain in this buffer, that is, if length>remaining(), then no bytes are transferred and a EvioException is thrown.

Otherwise, this method copies length bytes from the given array into this buffer, starting at the given pointer and at the current position of this buffer. The position of this buffer is then incremented by length.

parameterdescription.para: array from which bytes are to be read
number of bytes to be read from the given array; must be no larger than src array's size - offset.
if insufficient space in this buffer

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< uint8_t > &src, size_t offset, size_t length)
memberdef.name: put

briefdescription.para: Relative bulk put method.

detaileddescription.para: This method transfers bytes into this buffer from the given vector. If there are more bytes to be copied from the vector than remain in this buffer, that is, if length>remaining(), then no bytes are transferred and a EvioException is thrown.

Otherwise, this method copies length bytes from the given array into this buffer, starting at the given offset in the array and at the current position of this buffer. The position of this buffer is then incremented by length.

parameterdescription.para: array from which bytes are to be read
offset (bytes) within the array of the first byte to be read; must be no larger than src array's size.
number of bytes to be read from the given array; must be no larger than src array's size - offset.
if insufficient space in this buffer

briefdescription.para: Relative put method.

detaileddescription.para: Writes the given byte into this buffer at the current position, and then increments the position by one.

parameterdescription.para: byte value to be written.
if buffer's current position is not smaller than its limit

briefdescription.para: Absolute put method.

detaileddescription.para: Writes the given byte into this buffer at the given index.

parameterdescription.para: index at which the byte will be written.
byte value to be written.
if buffer's current position is not smaller than its limit

if there are fewer than eight bytes remaining in this buffer, i.e. not smaller than the buffer's limit, minus seven.

briefdescription.para: This method prints out the desired number of data bytes starting from the given index without regard to the limit.

parameterdescription.para: offset into data
number of bytes to print in hex
a label to print as header

briefdescription.para: Obtain a string representation of the buffer.

simplesect.para: a string representation of the buffer.

briefdescription.para: Copy the given buffer into a new buffer which is accessed thru shared pointer.

parameterdescription.para: ByteBuffer to copy.

briefdescription.para: Template for relative read methods.

detaileddescription.para:
More efficient than the templated method of this class.

briefdescription.para: Write 1 byte char at current position then increment position.

More efficient than the templated method of this class.

briefdescription.para: This class is copied from one of the same name in the Java programming language.

detaileddescription.para: It wraps an array or buffer of data and is extremely useful in reading and writing data. It's particularly useful when converting Java code to C++. For more info, read the Java ByteBuffer documentation.
